theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on permanent cell cycle arrest triggered by DNA damage, oxidative stress, and telomere shortening, with SASP driving tissue dysfunction and age-related lung diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere shortening and DNA damage response activating senescence pathways (p53-p21, p16-pRB) and SASP contributing to COPD and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of senescent cells with age due to DNA damage and telomere attrition, with SASP mediating age-related pathologies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights replicative senescence linked to telomere shortening and p16INK4a expression in aging kidney, connecting DNA damage to organ aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers senescence induced by DNA damage, telomere uncapping, mitochondrial dysfunction, and oncogene activation, with SASP mediating aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p21CIP1-CDK4-DREAM axis regulating genotoxic stress-induced senescence downstream of DNA damage response.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of senescent cells with SASP driving systemic aging and inflammation, linked to stress and DNA damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Astrocyte senescence driven by oxidative and proteotoxic stress, with SASP promoting neuroinflammation and brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Pak2 kinase regulating senescence via HIRA-mediated nucleosome assembly and histone variant H3.3 deposition affecting gene expression and SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Apoptosis Resistance and Survival Pathways in Senescent Cells Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cells developing anti-apoptotic pathways (SCAPs) that enable survival and accumulation, explaining resistance to senolytics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Driven Inflammation and Metabolic Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescent cells induce CD38+ macrophage activation via SASP, causing NAD+ decline and linking senescence to metabolic aging and inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Microglial Senescence and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Microglial cells undergo senescence-like changes causing functional decline and contributing to neurodegeneration distinct from reactive gliosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Microglial Senescence and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Microglial replicative senescence accelerated by amyloid promotes neurodegeneration and Alzheimer's disease progression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Post-Mitotic Cell Senescence and Brain Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence-like phenotype in post-mitotic neurons with SASP and dysfunctional autophagy contributing to brain aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Immune Cell Accumulation and Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescent immune cells (B, T, NK) accumulate with SASP secretion causing chronic inflammation and immune dysfunction during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Immune Cell Accumulation and Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Replicative senescence of memory CD8+ T cells driven by chronic antigen stimulation leads to immune aging and functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Cardiac cell senescence driven by replicative and stress-induced mechanisms with SASP promoting cardiovascular aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence via telomere shortening and stress-induced premature senescence with DNA damage response as central mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Replicative senescence limits cell division, accumulates with age, and contributes to tissue dysfunction and tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: DNA damage response and oxidative stress induce senescence and aging; gene expression overlaps between replicative and radiation-induced senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetic control of senescence via complementation groups and senescence-related genes (e.g., MORF4) underlies programmed cellular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p16INK4a-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p16INK4a protein triggers senescence and aging; genetic variants in CDKN2a/b locus modulate aging phenotypes and cancer protection.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: RNase-L Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: RNase-L induces senescence as tumor suppressor; its genetic disruption extends lifespan, linking RNase-L to aging regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence and Cancer Dual Role Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescence acts as tumor suppressor but SASP promotes tumor progression and age-related diseases; therapeutic targeting of senescence and SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Virus-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Viral infections induce senescence via cGAS-STING and DDR pathways; senescent cells secrete SASP promoting inflammation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Adipose Tissue Cellular Senescence and Metabolic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescent cells accumulate in fat tissue with aging/obesity, secreting SASP that drives inflammation, metabolic dysfunction, and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Apoptosis Resistance and Survival Pathways in Senescent Cells Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescent cells resist apoptosis via multiple mechanisms, leading to accumulation and promoting age-dependent diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Antigen and Oxidative Modification Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Band 3 protein oxidative modification generates senescent cell antigen marking cells for removal; implicated in aging and neurological diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence in Muscle Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Decline in autophagy with age leads to accumulation of damaged proteins/organelles, promoting muscle senescence, sarcopenia, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endothelial Cell Senescence and Cerebrovascular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescent endothelial cells with SASP cause vascular dysfunction, BBB disruption, and contribute to cerebrovascular and neurodegenerative aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Replicative lifespan limits and telomere shortening in macaque cells mirror human cellular aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescence induced by RAS-MAPK pathway mutations (RASopathies) causes premature aging via chronic senescence and SASP.
